meanings.definition: To wish for something more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She kept outwishing her friend for the biggest slice of cake.
meanings.sent2: He was always outwishing his siblings for the latest toys.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully outwished each other for the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outwish her competitors made her stand out.
meanings.sent5: Outwishing in a competition can sometimes lead to hurt feelings.

meanings.definition: To express a desire for something more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: He would often outwish his classmates for better grades.
meanings.sent2: She outwished her colleagues for a promotion at work.
meanings.sent3: The team playfully outwished each other for the best office space.
meanings.sent4: His constant outwishing for attention became tiresome to his friends.
meanings.sent5: Outwishing in a polite manner can sometimes lead to positive outcomes.
